business.headline: BEL share price: Why is it rising today and should you buy?BEL shares rose during the trading session on strong Rs 712 crore order inflow, supported by robust backlog and bullish technicals, keeping investor sentiment positive and suggesting potential further upside in the near-term trading sessions.

Urban Company shares list at 58% premium: Should you book profit or hold?Urban Company share price: The strong debut reflects the high demand for Urban Company's IPO, which had been among the most closely watched offerings of 2025.

Urban Company share price: Stock makes bumper debut at 58% premiumUrban Company listed at a 57.5% premium at Rs 162.25 on the NSE. On the BSE, the shares opened at Rs 161, marking a 56% gain over the Rs 103 issue price.

Experts bet big on this financial stock at record high. Should you buy?Experts recommend the financial stock as a strong buy for investors focusing on financial stocks, while also suggesting PSU banks, defence tech firms, and auto ancillary stocks as potential picks.

DreamFolks share price tumble 5% today. Why is it under pressure?DreamFolks shares fell sharply in early trade after the company quit the domestic lounge business, a move that could reshape its position in India's fast-evolving airport services market.

Urban Company shares debut on BSE, NSE today. Will it be a blockbuster listing?Urban Company share price: The company's stock market debut also comes at a time when benchmark indices are riding high on optimism around US-India trade talks and a widely expected Fed rate cut, factors that could further shape sentiment on its first trading day.

Sensex, Nifty open higher on upbeat trade talks, Fed rate cut in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 250.84 points higher at 82,631.53 at 9:24 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 78.15 points to 25,317.25. Volatility dropped sharply and most of the broader market indices were trading in the green.

Explained: Why Apollo Tyres shares are in focus todayApollo Tyres shares have gained 6% over the past month, even as they remain over 6% lower on a year-to-date basis. Analysts say the brand exposure from the deal could create long-term consumer stickiness, though the immediate financial payoff remains a question for the market.
Will ITR deadline be extended further as users complain of glitches?The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) had already extended the filing deadline by one day, from September 15 to September 16.

Urban Company listing today: Will it double investor wealth on market debut?Urban Company's IPO received overwhelming demand from all categories of investors despite some analysts calling it expensive and the subdued market conditions.

Missed September 16 ITR deadline? Here's how to file your return nowA look at options and consequences for taxpayers who do not file their income tax return by the extended due date of 16 September 2025, including late filing penalties, deadlines for belated returns, and whether tax regimes can be changed.

Confident of good outcome under PM Modi: Hardeep Puri on US-India trade talksAs US-India trade talks resumed with the arrival of the US chief negotiator in India, Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri expressed confidence of a good outcome under PM Modi.

entertainment.headline: The Housemaid: Sydney Sweeney gets pulled into web of secrets in suspense thrillerThe Housemaid', starring a star-studded cast, will hit theatres this December. Directed by Paul Feig, the film explores a young woman's struggle amidst a wealthy couple's tangled web of deception.

Mirai box office Day 5: Teja Sajja's fantasy epic roars on, takes over HanuManTeja Sajja's new fantasy film 'Mirai' is working wonders at the box office, collecting Rs 56.75 crore nett in 5 days. Matching the success of 'HanuMan', the Karthik Gattamneni directorial has scored big in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.

How Kishkindhapuri paves way for bigger Telugu horror films like The Raja Saab'Kishkindhapuri' may not be a flawless horror film, but it signals hope for Telugu cinema's haunted genre. Ambitious and textured, the film explores suspense and atmosphere while showing that the industry still has room to grow.

Madhavan shares his Modi story: He's not just a leader, a human who values peopleActor R Madhavan recalled his first selfie moment with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 75th birthday. In a post on X, he spoke about how PM Modi recognised him even when he was in a different look (as scientist Nambi Narayanan) during the 'Rocketry' shoot.

Robert Redford dies at 89: Priyanka Chopra to Anil Kapoor, Bollywood honours legacyThe world mourns the loss of Hollywood legend Robert Redford, whose iconic roles and storytelling prowess left a lasting impact across global cinema, including Bollywood. Indian film stars united on social media to pay heartfelt tributes, celebrating his timeless charm.

Director Mari Selvaraj faces backlash for platforming sexual abuser Vedan in BisonTamil director Mari Selvaraj was called out on the Internet for collaborating with rapper Vedan for a song in his upcoming film, 'Bison'. Rapper Vedan was accused by multiple women of sexual harassment and is currently being investigated for a rape case.

Ajith's Good Bad Ugly removed from Netflix over Ilaiyaraaja's copyright disputeAjith Kumar-starrer 'Good Bad Ugly' has been removed from Netflix after a court order. The removal follows a copyright dispute concerning unauthorised use of Ilaiyaraaja's songs in the film.

He stood for America: Jane Fonda, Meryl Streep's tribute to Robert RedfordActor Robert Redford's death at 89 prompts tributes from former co-stars and industry peers. Jane Fonda, Meryl Streep, Morgan Freeman, and others share reflections on his legacy.

Margot Robbie stuns in vintage Mugler at A Big Bold Beautiful journey premiereActors Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell made a stylish appearance at the premiere of their upcoming film 'A Big Bold Beautiful Journey' in New York.

US Consul General meets Jr NTR, stresses on bilateral relations, job creationActor Jr NTR met US Consul General Laura Williams in Hyderabad. Williams shared a social media post highlighting the growing collaboration and stronger ties between India and the United States.

Rise & Fall: Pawan Singh tells Nayandeep Rakshit to wear saree, bindi. Video viralA video from reality show 'Rise & Fall' featuring Pawan Singh and Nayandeep Rakshit has gone viral. In the clip, Pawan can be seen telling Nayandeep to wear a saree and a bindi.

Akshay, Arshad's Jolly LLB 3 gets U/A rating - alcohol brand, abusive dialogues cut'Jolly LLB 3' received a U/A certificate after the CBFC suggested a few modifications. The courtroom-drama features actors Akshay Kumar, Arshad Warsi, Huma Qureshi and Amrita Rao in key roles.

After Saiyaara, Aneet Padda to star in a courtroom drama: ReportActor Aneet Padda, following her successful debut in Saiyaara, has reportedly signed her next film. Unlike what many were expecting, her next film is not going to be romantic. Here's everything you need to know about her next film.

Thalapathy Vijay's classic Kushi returns to theatres after 25 yearsThalapathy Vijay and Jyotika's romantic comedy 'Kushi' is set to return to the big screen. Marking 25 years since its original release, the film will be re-released in theatres on 25 September.

After NGO, Parag Tyagi starts YouTube channel in memory of Shefali JariwalaParag Tyagi has launched a YouTube channel to share his and late wife Shefali Jariwala's story, with proceeds going to the Shefali Jariwala Rise Foundation. The initiative follows his pledge to carry forward Shefali's dreams of supporting underprivileged children and empowering women.

Ileana D'Cruz reveals she almost quit Barfi! after Anurag Basu's outburstIleana D'Cruz shared that she almost quit 'Barfi' after director Anurag Basu lashed out at her on set, leaving her in tears. The actor said she was calmed down by producer Siddharth Roy Kapur, after which she reconciled with Basu and continued with the film.

Raghav Juyal shares why Aryan Khan rarely smiles on cameraRaghav Juyal shared that Aryan Khan avoids smiling on camera due to a "phobia," preferring to maintain a serious persona despite his playful side off-screen. Aryan is all set to make his directorial debut with the Netflix satire 'Ba***ds of Bollywood', releasing on September 18.

Vir Das says it's impossible to gauge sensitivities before show: Am not that artisteVir Das announced his new stand-up tour 'Sounds of India', celebrating the country's everyday rhythms from Kanyakumari to Kashmir. At the launch, the Emmy-winning comedian opened up about the challenge of balancing comedy with social responsibility.

Robert Redford, Oscar-winning actor and director, dies at 89Actor-director Robert Redford, known for his role in 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid', died at the age of 89. He was celebrated for his iconic roles and for founding the Sundance Institute, which nurtured independent filmmakers across the globe.

general news.headline: Thank you, Narendra: Trump's olive branch after weeks of India-bashing on oilPrime Minister Modi and Donald Trump reconnected after months with a warm birthday call. Since their last conversation in June, India-US ties have nosedived due to hefty tariffs and Washington's hammering of New Delhi over Russian oil buys.

I worry about...: Suspect confesses to trans partner after shooting Charlie KirkThe suspect appeared virtually for his first court hearing today after being formally charged on seven counts. Prosecutors said they would seek the death penalty, citing text messages and a handwritten note in which he appeared to confess to the crime.

18 dead as heavy rain, landslides batter Uttarakhand, Himachal; rescue ops onCloudbursts and landslides have caused severe damage across Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, killing 18 people. Rescue operations are ongoing amid warnings of continued heavy rain and flooding.

Call made at 7.45, not 8: Journalist says US knew well in advance about Doha strikeAxios reporter Barak Ravid revealed that at least three senior Israeli officials told him Netanyahu informed Trump an hour before Israel's strike on Hamas leaders in Qatar.

From the India Today archives (2014) | The man behind Narendra ModiNarendra Modi turning 75 is also time to remember Lakshmanrao Inamdar, the RSS veteran who perhaps had the most profound impact on the prime minister's early years

Fed up with bad roads, logistics firm BlackBuck to ditch outer Bengaluru officeBlackBuck, a logistics tech platform is leaving its Outer Ring Road office in Bengaluru, citing worsening traffic and pothole-ridden roads. Staff commutes exceed 1.5 hours, says CEO. The company clarified it is not leaving Bengaluru and is seeking another city location.

Thank you, my friend: PM gets birthday call from Trump, backs his Ukraine peace pushThis was the first call between the two world leaders since June 17. The relationship between India and US turned sour after Trump imposed an additional sanction of 25 per cent on India, with total levy of 50 per cent.

Pakistan pushes for Islamic Nato. What's in it for India?At a summit of over 40 Muslim countries in Doha after Israel's strike in Qatar, a proposal was floated for an Islamic Nato. Pakistan aggressively pitched for an "Arab-Islamic task force", reviving talks about a Nato-style military alliance. Though targeted at Israel, does the bloc, with Pakistan and Turkey, have any implications for India?

Viswanathan Anand recalls the best Gujarati Thali he had. Guess who served it?As India celebrates Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday, tributes have poured in from across the nation. Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand recalled a moment with the Prime Minister that went far beyond the chessboard.
The 80% gap: Why most Indians are underinsured and why it's time to actThe solution lies in choosing a comprehensive life cover that reflects modern realities.

Maoists offer temporary suspension of armed op, urge Centre for month-long truceThe statement declared the Maoists' intention to suspend armed activities and seek unity with other political parties working for public causes.

Congress MPs voted for NDA's Veep candidate on Revanth Reddy's orders: BRS MLAA Bharat Rashtra Samithi MLA alleged that several Congress MPs voted for CP Radhakrishnan for the Vice President post on the instruction of Revanth Reddy.

The Summer I Turned Pretty watch parties take over Indian clubsThe Summer I Turned Pretty has brought the West's beloved web-series watch party culture to India. Fans are excited to bond over shared gasps, tears, and heated team debates at hep clubs.

Cloudflare CEO warns AI could turn internet into a Black Mirror world run by big techCloudflare CEO Matthew Prince has warned that artificial intelligence could push the internet into a Black Mirror-like future, where a few tech giants control the flow of information.

Whisper to roar: Sarvesh Kushare's leap into the world's eliteSarvesh Kushare cleared 2.28m to finish sixth in Tokyo, the highest-ever by an Indian high jumper at a World Championship, turning a world ranking of 38 into a stage where his belief outjumped expectations.

Trump will cut you loose: Kash Patel clashes with Democrats during Senate testimonyFBI Director Kash Patel told the Senate panel there was no credible information that Jeffrey Epstein trafficked women and underage girls to anyone but himself, seeking to defuse criticism of the Trump administration's move to end its review of the case.

Javelin: Neeraj and Arshad in focus as 4 Indians eye berths in finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: While the spotlight will be on defending champion Neeraj Chopra and Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem, as many as four Indians will look to make it to the final. The qualification round gets underway at 3:40 pm IST with 84.50m being the automatic qualification mark.

What husband of BMW crash accused, who was in car during accident, told copsDuring questioning, Parikshit could not explain how the accident happened and said his wife, Gaganpreet, took the victims to a hospital by taxi while he followed separately. Police are verifying his version with call detail records and location data.

Unshaven, in protective vest: Charlie Kirk murder accused in 1st court appearanceProsecutors are seeking the death penalty, presenting new evidence in the form of text messages sent to his live-in partner, in which Tyler Robinson allegedly admitted to fatally shooting the conservative activist Charlie Kirk at Utah University last week.

Odisha artist celebrates PM Modi's birthday with sand art featuring 750 lotusesIn a post on X, Sudarsan Pattnaik shared a picture of the artwork which features a striking sculpture of PM Modi decorated with 750 lotus flowers.

Here's how to file your return nowA look at options and consequences for taxpayers who do not file their income tax return by the extended due date of 16 September 2025, including late filing penalties, deadlines for belated returns, and whether tax regimes can be changed.

Maruti Suzuki Victoris vs rivals: Can it take on Creta, Seltos, Taigun, Curvv?Maruti Suzuki has launched the Victoris to shake up the mid-size SUV space, taking direct aim at segment leaders like the Creta, Seltos, Taigun, Kushaq, Curvv, Grand Vitara and Hyryder with sharp pricing, hybrid tech and premium features.

Anti-immigrant UK leader Tommy Robinson has surprising take on IndiansDespite his hardline anti-immigrant stance, UK leader Tommy Robinson has repeatedly praised Indians, particularly Hindus, calling them allies who integrate into British life. Robinson, who recently led a massive rally through the heart of London, had pledged street muscle for Hindus, who he saw as distinctly different from other immigrants.

sports.headline: World Athletics Champs Day 5 schedule: Neeraj Chopra and Animesh Kujur headline busy day for IndiaIndia's Day 5 at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo spotlights Neeraj Chopra in javelin and Animesh Kujur in the 200m, with multiple athletes across field and track events aiming for strong qualification performances.

Under-pressure Pakistan face resilient UAE in tricky do-or-die clashAsia Cup 2025, PAK vs UAE: Salman Agha's Pakistan and Muhammad Waseem's UAE are set to lock horns in a crucial Group A clash on Wednesday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Viswanathan Anand recalls the best Gujarati Thali he had. Guess who served it?As India celebrates Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 75th birthday, tributes have poured in from across the nation. Grandmaster Viswanathan Anand recalled a moment with the Prime Minister that went far beyond the chessboard.

Champions League: Real Madrid edge Marseille, Juventus and Dortmund share goal festReal Madrid secured a 2-1 win over Marseille thanks to Kylian Mbappe's penalties, despite playing the final stages with 10 men. Juventus and Borussia Dortmund shared a thrilling 4-4 draw, with all eight goals coming after the break.

Abusing Suryakumar Yadav is total stupidity: Madan Lal slams Mohammad YousufMadan Lal condemned Mohammad Yousuf's derogatory remark on Suryakumar Yadav, branding it "stupidity" unworthy of a former cricketer. The controversy added fuel to an already tense India-Pakistan clash marked by handshake snubs and PCB protests.

Javelin: Neeraj and Arshad in focus as 4 Indians eye berths in finalWorld Athletics Championships 2025: While the spotlight will be on defending champion Neeraj Chopra and Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem, as many as four Indians will look to make it to the final. The qualification round gets underway at 3:40 pm IST with 84.50m being the automatic qualification mark.

Neeraj Chopra vs Arshad Nadeem: How the India vs Pakistan javelin rivalry stacks upNeeraj Chopra vs Arshad Nadeem, World Athletics Championships: India's Neeraj Chopra holds a commanding 9-1 lead in head-to-head contests against Pakistan's Arshad Nadeem in men's javelin throw. Their rivalry has become one of the most compelling storylines in international athletics, especially on the stage of the Olympics and World Championships.

Whisper to roar: Sarvesh Kushare's leap into the world's eliteSarvesh Kushare cleared 2.28m to finish sixth in Tokyo, the highest-ever by an Indian high jumper at a World Championship, turning a world ranking of 38 into a stage where his belief outjumped expectations.

Asia Cup: Litton Das stays coy on backing Sri Lanka for Bangladesh's Super 4s raceBangladesh captain Litton Das remains coy on supporting Sri Lanka in Asia Cup Super 4s race. The Tigers' tournament fate now hinges on the Sri Lanka-Afghanistan match outcome.

Asia Cup 2025: Bangladesh's Super 4 hopes rest on 'Naagin' rivals, Sri LankaBangladesh's Super 4 hopes hinge on Sri Lanka's clash against Afghanistan. The final Group B match could trigger a three-way tie decided by net run rate.

Pakistan make U-turn on boycott threat, will go ahead with UAE match: SourcesPakistan's dramatic boycott threat has ended in a U-turn. Despite the ICC rejecting their demand to remove match referee Andy Pycroft, sources told India Today that Pakistan will face the UAE on Wednesday in Dubai. The decision followed consultations between PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi and Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif.

Their rivalry has become one of the most compelling storylines in international athletics, especially on the stage of the Olympics and World Championships.

Pakistan make U-turn on boycott threat, will go ahead with UAE match: SourcesPakistan's dramatic boycott threat has ended in a U-turn. Despite the ICC rejecting their demand to remove match referee Andy Pycroft, sources told India Today that Pakistan will face the UAE on Wednesday in Dubai. The decision followed consultations between PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi and Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
